about.title: About me
about.content: I am Paul Viandier, a web developer passionate about cybersecurity. Currently training as a web integrator on a work-study program, I am acquiring a solid foundation in development and integration. My goal is to continue with training as a full-stack web developer in order to broaden my skills, understand the entire production chain of a web project, and be able to manage both the frontend and backend. As a web developer, I specialize in creating modern web applications with TypeScript, React and Next.js. My portfolio showcases my projects and web development skills.

problem.title: The Problem
problem.description: A paper resume or PDF is no longer enough to stand out. Recruiters and clients want to see real work: a functional interface, clean code, and attention to detail. A static document explains, but proves nothing.

solution.title: The Solution
solution.description: Build an interactive portfolio that demonstrates my skills in action. Every technical choice, every interface detail, every interaction is tangible proof of my expertise â€” not just a list of technologies I know.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Here you will find answers to frequently asked questions about my work, skills, and projects. If your question is not listed, please feel free to contact me directly.

question1.question: How can I contact you?
question1.answer: You can email me at contact@paulviandier.com or use the contact form in the Contact section.

question2.question: Which languages and technologies do you work with?
question2.answer: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS. I also use Node.js for APIs and scripts.

question3.question: Which projects can I check out?
question3.answer: All my projects are listed in the Projects section. Each project page explains the goal, the technical choices, and the outcome.

question4.question: What kinds of projects do you build?
question4.answer: Landing pages, dashboards, Next.js web apps, product-focused interfaces, and internal tools.

question5.question: Do you work more as a front-end developer or full-stack?
question5.answer: Iâ€™m strongly front-end oriented (UI/UX, performance, accessibility), but I can also handle part of the back end (APIs, authentication, integrations). Long-term, my goal is to build strong full-stack skills.

question6.question: Do you use UI component libraries, or do you build components yourself?
question6.answer: Both. I use solid foundations (Radix, shadcn/ui) when it makes sense, and I build custom components when a precise result is needed.

question7.question: How do you handle performance and SEO?
question7.answer: Image optimization, progressive loading, code-splitting, clean metadata, sitemaps, and Next.js best practices.

question8.question: Do you pay attention to accessibility?
question8.answer: Yes: keyboard navigation, contrast, labels, semantic HTML, and accessible components (Radix helps a lot with this).

question9.question: Whatâ€™s your development workflow?
question9.answer: I start from a clear goal, build a quick UI base, then iterate: code quality, manual testing, performance, and polish.

question10.question: Can you work from an existing design?
question10.answer: Yes. I can implement a Figma design faithfully, or propose a simple, consistent UI direction if needed.

question11.question: How do you handle internationalization (i18n)?
question11.answer: With next-intl: clean locale-based routing, structured translations, and language-appropriate date/time formats and typography.

question12.question: Do you follow coding standards?
question12.answer: Yes: strict TypeScript, reusable components, naming conventions, lint/format, and a clear separation between UI and logic.

question13.question: How do you manage state and data?
question13.answer: Depending on the need: local React state, lightweight stores when necessary, and server/client fetching with proper loading and error handling.

question14.question: Can you integrate external APIs or services?
question14.answer: Yes: authentication, payments, emailing, analytics, CMS, and anything that provides a reliable API.

question15.question: What sets you apart?
question15.answer: A product-driven approach: clean UI, robust logic, polished details, and real attention to perceived quality.
